channel.title: Red Teaming on Trevor Saudi
channel.description: Recent content in Red Teaming on Trevor Saudi

item.title: Analysis and Exploitation of a Parser Differential Bug
item.description: Introduction # Came across a fascinating vulnerability when reviewing past challenges in a past ‘infamous’ Google CTF Web Challenge.

item.title: Creating malicious .MSIX files for initial access
item.description: Introduction # I recently worked on a project involving adversary emulation of the BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware operation.

item.title: Malware development: Building malware with 0 imports
item.description: Introduction # Modern AV solutions primarily work in 2 ways: static and dynamic analysis.

item.title: Malware development: APC Injection with C++
item.description: Introduction # In our previous blog post, we looked into classic process injection, going into the various techniques such as finding target processes to inject to using Windows APIs, as well as injecting into the said processes.

item.title: Malware development: Process Injection with C++
item.description: Introduction # In the previous article we explored how we can write a simple stageless C++ dropper.

item.title: Malware Development: Writing a C++ dropper
item.description: Introduction # Welcome to another red teaming blog post where we dive into malware development and how we can write malware using C/C++.

item.title: Email Phishing with Covenant
item.description: Introduction # Phishing attacks have become increasingly sophisticated and prevalent over the years, posing a significant threat to individuals and organizations alike.
